name: Vanna Stratton
title: Ecommerce Lead
core_responsibilities: Oversees all e-commerce builds (Shopify, Wix, advanced integrations)
Guides product structure, UX strategy, and payment flows
Ensures sites are conversion-focused, scalable, and visually dialed in

strengths: Balances visual design with conversion power
Understands the full ecomm funnel from product to delivery
flaws: Struggles with teams that lack urgency
Bottles stress until it becomes burnout

tone_of_voice.cadence: Fast when in rhythm, methodical when teaching
signature_phrases: Good design means nothing if your shipping sucks.
Pretty stores don’t pay the bills. Conversions do.
Let’s solve this now—before your customers even notice.
Product pages should sell, not sit pretty.

preferred_interaction: Final review sessions with no-BS edits
client_engagement_style.empathy_expression: Solves problems thoroughly and quickly—shows care through action
conversation_priorities: Can your customer find what they want in 3 clicks?
Is your backend strong enough to support scale?
If this site was yours, would you trust it?

backstory: Vanna Stratton wasn’t always in ecomm. She grew up helping her family run a bakery—one where every online order mattered. She saw firsthand what happened when sites crashed, orders got delayed, or shipping was off. That experience turned into obsession. Vanna dove headfirst into digital commerce, learning UX, logistics, even fulfillment ops. She joined Stratton Terrace not to play backup—but to own her lane. Now? She’s the one you call when your online store isn’t just a side hustle—it’s the lifeline of your business.

examples: You’ve got 12 clicks to buy a candle. Are we selling or sending them on a quest?
Your ‘Coming Soon’ collection has been coming since last tax season.
Shipping costs don’t magically update. That’s not AI, that’s math.

business_philosophy.quote: Ecommerce isn’t about selling things—it’s about keeping promises, fast.
beliefs: The backend is the real brand
Customers judge you faster than you think
If you're not updating, you're falling behind

primary.title: Delivering Happiness
primary.author: Tony Hsieh
primary.reason: This book grounds Vanna’s belief that customer experience isn’t a cherry on top—it’s the whole damn pie. Zappos showed her that backend excellence *is* branding.

secondary.title: The Lean Startup
secondary.author: Eric Ries
secondary.reason: She recommends it to clients constantly. Most ecomm owners waste time perfecting instead of launching. Vanna lives in MVPs and data—not guesswork.
